Python Wideband Aggregate SPectrum GENerator (PyWASPGEN)

The PyWASPGEN Package

pywaspgen.burst_datagen module

This module provides functionality for generating burst data via the BurstDatagen object.

class pywaspgen.burst_datagen.BurstDatagen(config_file='configs/default.json')[source]

Bases: object

Used to create burst definition objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef, that specify the time and frequency extent of a burst as well as the burst’s metadata. These objects are used as input to pywaspgen.iq_datagen.IQDatagen to create in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data.

__init__(config_file='configs/default.json')[source]

The constructor for the BurstDatagen class.

Parameters:

config_file (str) – The relative file path for the configuration file to be used for generating random burst definition objects.

__check_collisions(candidate_burst, burst_list)

Checks if a burst overlaps with other bursts in time and frequency.

Parameters:

  • candidate_burst (obj) – The burst_def objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef, to check for overlaps.

  • burst_list (obj) – The list of burst_def objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef, to check the candidate burst against.

Returns:

True if candidate_burst overlaps in time and frequency with any burst in the burst_list, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

gen_burst(rng=None)[source]

Generates a random pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef object.

Parameters:

rng (obj) – A numpy random generator object used by the random generators.

Returns:

A pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef object with random parameters in ranges specified by the configuration file.

Return type:

obj

gen_burstlist(burst_idx=-1)[source]

Generates a random burst list of pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef objects.

Parameters:

burst_idx (int) – Index for multiprocessing randomization bookkeeping by pywaspgen.burst_datagen.BurstDatagen.gen_batch(). Not used otherwise.

Returns:

A list of pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef objects each with random parameters in ranges specified by the configuration file.

Return type:

obj

gen_batch(batch_size)[source]

Generates a batch of burst lists using multiprocessing across cpu cores.

Parameters:

batch_size (int) – The number of burst lists to generate through multiprocessing.

Returns:

A list, of size defined by batch_size, of burst lists of burst_def objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef, with random parameters in ranges specified by the configuration file.

Return type:

obj

plot_burstdata(burst_list, ax=[])[source]

Plots and labels the bounding boxes of all bursts.

Parameters:

  • burst_list (obj) – The list of pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef objects to plot.

  • ax (obj) – Matplotlib axis in which to put the plot.

Returns:

Matplotlib labeled plot of the bounding boxes of all bursts in burst_list.

Return type:

obj

pywaspgen.burst_def module

This module defines the structure and behavior of bursts via the BurstDef object.

class pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef(cent_freq, bandwidth, start, duration, sig_type, metadata={})[source]

Bases: object

Used to create burst definition objects that specify the time and frequency extent of a burst as well as the burst’s metadata. These objects are passed as input to pywaspgen.iq_datagen.IQDatagen to create in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data.

__init__(cent_freq, bandwidth, start, duration, sig_type, metadata={})[source]

The constructor for the burst_def class.

Parameters:

  • cent_freq (float) – The normalized center frequency, or mid-point in frequency, of the burst (in Hz).

  • bandwidth (float) – The normalized bandwidth of the burst (in Hz).

  • start (int) – The normalized start time of the burst (in sec).

  • duration (int) – The duration of the burst (in sec).

  • sig_type (dict) – The signal type of the burst.

  • metadata (dict) – The signal metadata of the burst.

get_low_freq()[source]
Returns:

The lower edge of the bandwidth of the burst (in Hz).

Return type:

float

get_high_freq()[source]
Returns:

The higher edge of the bandwidth of the burst (in Hz).

Return type:

float

get_mid_time()[source]
Returns:

The center time, or mid-time, of the burst (in seconds).

Return type:

int

get_end_time()[source]
Returns:

The end time of the burst (in seconds).

Return type:

int

pywaspgen.impairments module

This module provides functions for adding impairments to in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data.

pywaspgen.impairments.awgn(samps, snr_db)[source]

Applies Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) to the IQ data samps. Assumes the IQ data is normalized to unit average power.

Parameters:

  • samps (float complex) – The IQ data to apply AWGN to.

  • snr_db (float) – The signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), in dB, of the returned IQ data.

Returns:

The input IQ data, samps, impaired by AWGN with a SNR (in dB) specified by snr_db.

Return type:

float complex

pywaspgen.impairments.freq_off(samps, freq)[source]

Applies a complex frequency shift to the IQ data.

Parameters:

  • samps (float complex) – The IQ data to apply a complex frequency shift to.

  • freq (float) – The amount of frequency by which to shift the IQ data by.

Returns:

The input IQ data, samps, impaired by a complex frequency shift specified by freq.

Return type:

float complex

pywaspgen.filters module

This module provides classes for resampling and pulseshaping in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data.

class pywaspgen.filters._Filter(pulse_type={'format': 'RRC', 'params': {'beta': 0.35, 'span': 10, 'window': ('kaiser', 5.0)}, 'sps': 2})[source]

Bases: object

Base class for performing pulse shape filtering of IQ data.

__init__(pulse_type={'format': 'RRC', 'params': {'beta': 0.35, 'span': 10, 'window': ('kaiser', 5.0)}, 'sps': 2})[source]

The constructor for the _Filter class.

Parameters:

pulse_type (dict) – The pulse shape metadata of the burst.

filter(data, type)[source]

Applies either a interpolation or decimation filter to the input IQ data using a specified pulse shaping filter.

Parameters:

  • data (float complex) – The IQ data to apply the filtering to.

  • type (str) – Specifies whether an ‘interpolation’ or ‘decimation’ filter is applied to the input IQ data.

Returns:

The input IQ data, data, after filtering of type defined by the pulse shaping filter of type self.pulse_type.

Return type:

float complex

calc_num_symbols(num_samples)[source]

Calculates the number of modulated IQ data symbols needed to achieve a specified number of output samples after applying an interpolation filter.

Parameters:

num_samples (int) – The number of IQ samples wanted after filtering.

Returns:

The number of modulated IQ data symbols needed to achieve the amount of IQ samples specified by num_samples after applying an interpolation filter.

Return type:

int

_Filter__downsample(data)

Downsamples the input IQ data.

Parameters:

data (float complex) – The IQ data to downsample.

Returns:

The upsampled data.

Return type:

float complex

_Filter__upsample(data)

Upsamples the input IQ data.

Parameters:

data (float complex) – The IQ data to upsample.

Returns:

The downsampled data.

Return type:

float complex

The RRC filter taps to be used for filtering.

pywaspgen.iq_datagen module

This module provides functionality for generating in-phase/quadrature(IQ) data from bursts via the IQDatagen object.

class pywaspgen.iq_datagen.IQDatagen(config_file='configs/default.json')[source]

Bases: object

Used to create in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data given burst definition objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef.

__init__(config_file='configs/default.json')[source]

The constructor for the IQDatagen class.

Parameters:

config_file (str) – The relative file path for the configuration file to be used for generating the IQ data.

_get_iq(burst)[source]

Generates IQ data for a burst definition, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef.

Parameters:

burst (obj) – The pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef object to create IQ data for.

Returns:

The IQ data of the provided burst definition, the pywaspgen.modems object used to create the IQ data.

Return type:

float complex, obj

gen_batch(burst_lists)[source]

Generates a batch of IQ data using multiprocessing across cpu cores.

Parameters:

burst_lists (obj) – A list of burst lists of pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef objects.

Returns:

A list of numpy IQ data arrays for the provided burst_lists.

Return type:

float complex

gen_iqdata(burst_list, data_idx=-1)[source]

Generates a random aggregate IQ data from the provided burst_list with modem parameters randomized based on ranges specified by the configuration file.

Parameters:

  • burst_list (obj) – The list of burst_def objects, of type pywaspgen.burst_def.BurstDef, to create the IQ data.

  • data_idx (int) – Index for multiprocessing randomization bookkeeping by the gen_batch function. Not used otherwise.

Returns:

A numpy array of aggregate IQ data generated from the burst_list, An updated burst_list with values adjusted based on the parameters used to create the aggregate IQ data.

Return type:

float complex, obj

plot_iqdata(iq_data, ax=[])[source]

Plots the spectrogram of provided IQ data.

Parameters:

  • iq_data (float complex) – The IQ data to compute the spectrogram of.

  • ax (obj) – Matplotlib axis in which to put the plot.

Returns:

Matplotlib plot of the spectrogram of the IQ data.

Return type:

obj

pywaspgen.modems module

This module defines classes for generating modulators and demodulators (modems) for generating in-phase/quadrature (IQ) data of specific communication formats.

class pywaspgen.modems.LDAPM(sig_type={'format': 'psk', 'order': 4}, pulse_type={'format': 'RRC', 'params': {'beta': 0.35, 'span': 10, 'window': ('kaiser', 5.0)}, 'sps': 2})[source]

Bases: object

Linear Digital Amplitude Phase Modulation (LDAPM) modem class.

__init__(sig_type={'format': 'psk', 'order': 4}, pulse_type={'format': 'RRC', 'params': {'beta': 0.35, 'span': 10, 'window': ('kaiser', 5.0)}, 'sps': 2})[source]

The constructor for the LDAPM class.

Parameters:

  • sig_type (dict) – The signal type of the modem.

  • pulse_type (dict) – The pulse shape metadata of the modem.

__symbol_table_create()

Creates the modem’s IQ data symbol table of the type specified by LDAPM.sig_type.

__symbol_table_norm()

Normalizes the modem’s IQ data symbol table to have unit average energy.

__set_pulse_shape()

Sets the pulse shaping filter of the modem based on LDAPM.pulse_type.

set_sps(sps)[source]

Sets the samples per symbol of the modem.

Parameters:

sps (float) – The samples per symbol to be used by the modem when performing filtering operations.

gen_symbols(num_symbols)[source]

Generates a random set of symbols from the modem’s IQ data symbol table.

Parameters:

num_symbols (int) – The number of random IQ data symbols to generate.

Returns:

A numpy array, of size defined by num_symbols, of random IQ data symbols chosen uniformly from the modem’s IQ data symbol table.

Return type:

float complex

get_samples(symbols)[source]

Modulates an IQ data symbols stream.

Parameters:

symbols (float complex) – The IQ data symbols to be modulated.

Returns:

A numpy array of modulated IQ data symbols provided by symbols.

Return type:

float complex

gen_samples(num_samples)[source]

Generates a random modulated IQ data sample stream of pulse shaped IQ data symbols from the modem’s IQ data symbol table.

Parameters:

num_samples (int) – The length, in samples, of the random modulated IQ data sample stream to generate.

Returns:

A numpy array, of size defined by num_samples, of pulse shaped IQ data symbols chosen uniformly from the modem’s IQ data symbol table.

Return type:

float complex

get_symbols(samples)[source]

Demodulates a modulated IQ data sample stream.

Parameters:

samples (float complex) – The modulated IQ data symbols to be demodulated.

Returns:

A numpy array of demodulated IQ data symbols calculated from samples.

Return type:

float complex

get_nearest_symbol(symbol)[source]

Determines the nearest symbol of the modem’s IQ data symbol table to the provided input symbol.

Parameters:

symbol (float complex) – The IQ symbol to find the nearest symbol to.

Returns:

The symbol of the modem’s IQ data symbol table nearest to symbol.

Return type:

float complex

get_theory_awgn(snr_db)[source]

Calculates the theoretical symbol error rate of the modem when impacted by an Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) channel.

Parameters:

snr_db (float) – The signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), in dB, to get the symbol error rate for.

Returns:

The theoretical symbol error rate in an AWGN channel of the modem for an SNR, in dB, specified by snr_db.

Return type:

float
